info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 9 at 3:30AM EST until November 9 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gaylord MI
info.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches across eastern Cheboygan county. Localized amounts greater than 6 inches possible. Lesser amounts of 1 to 3 inches expected across western Cheboygan county.
* WHERE...Cheboygan County.
* WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 7 PM EST this evening.
* IMPACTS...High snowfall rates will lead to quick accumulations on roads and rapid drops in visibility, making for hazardous travel conditions at times.
info.instruction:
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
During lake effect snow, the weather can vary from bands of locally heavy snow to dry weather just a few miles away. Visibilities can also vary greatly. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather, visibility, and road conditions.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EST THIS EVENING
